intro: Saxifraga obtusa, commonly known as the blunt saxifrage, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant features upright stems with opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are usually covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hairs. Its flowers are small, pink to purple, and appear in clusters at the ends of the stems during the summer months. Saxifraga obtusa is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
